Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem, steps from the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not for those looking for a delux 5 star brand name. That said, it has many attributes missing in the former like an excellent morning breakfast served from 7:30 am onwards in a sky lit enclosed verandah behind the lobby. The rooms are not large but adequate and have everything including free WiFi and excellent amenities in the bathroom. If you're visiting the Vatican or even Rome (the metro is a mere 10 minute walk) it is perfect and affordable. The only negative is that there is no elevator but the front desk staff is quick about taking all baggage up to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to Rome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tniemann
Reviews.Content: My family used to live in Italy, so we could go to Rome pretty often. This hotel is absolutely fantastic- we got to staying there so much that the owner knew the family! It's in a great location, good rooms, and it's a small place so you get individual attention. This is the only hotel we stay in in Rome. Unfortunately, we moved away from Europe so we don't stay there any longer, but if we ever go back to Rome, we will certainly stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's like being apart of one big family”
Reviews.Author: nwdwells
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here back in 2006 and thought it was wonderful. After looking at their website however I had my reservations. So needless to say their website definately needs a make over. But what my impressions I had from the website couldnt be further from the trueth. On arrival we were greated by smiling faces and a "allo Mrs Wells" (my husband actually arrived a few days after us due to work commitments). They had arranged for us to have a double and a single bed in our room to fit my husband, son and I. The rooms and decor throughout the hotel is wonderfully welcoming. Admitedly, the shower was tiny. Only JUST enough room for my son and I. But that was the least of our worries. We were so happy to be in Italy nothing really mattered. The breakfasts here were seriously AMAZING! It's not worth going anywhere else in Roma for breakfast as they are brilliant right downstairs. Freshly brewed coffee was offered to us, which after two days they stopped asking what we wanted and made our regualr which was a really lovely touch. My son is crazy for berries, so they had a bowl of berries for him every morning with some juice and a special child seat. We felt really special and well looked after at Bramante. Their omletes were perfect too! Their is a house cat that loves the company of the hotel guests. Nikita. So if you have allergies you will have to be careful. Our son loved having the cat about our room, so we left our window open so she could come and go as she pleased. Once we found Nikita asleep with our son in bed one afternoon. Was wonderful.. When in Rome :) But again warning if you have allergies or get hay fever. Dry cleaning is quite expensive but they will iron your clothes for you for free if directed. And the maid will attend your room every day which is nice. The mini bar is quite affordable too and you will probably find you will drink a lot of the bottled water. Location is amazing. It is literally less than a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. A HUGE tip to remember.. that we found out the hard way. If you go to see any public monuments during peek travel periods, our suggestion would be to go in the afternoon. We waited 3 hours to get inside the Coloseum with lots of pushing a shoving.. which is just horrid when you have an impatient 2 year old. However, by the time we left in the afternoon, the line in was a lot shorter and quieter. This family run business is far better than other higher star hotels we stayed on this trip. Everyone is so friendly and you never feel like you are asking for too much. I think you will really enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Ex-airfaircrew
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a tiny backstreet in Vatican City, this charming hotel offers a peaceful retreat from the wonderful, hectic craziness that is Rome. It is literally steps to the Vatican Museums, St.Peter's Basilica, and an array of good trattorias. This was our second visit to this hotel; we walked everywhere in Rome from this location. Our rooms, on both occasions were spacious, high-ceilinged and spotless. The hotel offers a wonderful roof-like garden, perfect for reading and/or relaxing after a long day of touring. Breakfast is a feast for the eyes and stomach! What makes this hotel truly uinique is its family-run atmosphere. After our 5 night stay, we felt like a member of an extended family, such is the care and service provided. Wonderful touring and restuarant recommendations!!! We would most definitely stay at the Bramante on any future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: LamCritic
Reviews.Content: Wake up early, have a homey breakfast and chat with the wonderful staff, take a left out the hotel walk one block and turn yourself right on Via della Conciliazione and marvel at the sight of the sun rising over the right shoulder of St. Peter's without the hoards of tourists... go in and enjoy the cathedral. Later head to the Caffe Nova (on via conciliazione) for an espresso and a snack and go hang out at the Piazza Navona. Check out the Pantheon and the Caravaggios nearby, then head back to your quiet, clean, comfortable and handsome hotel. Rome is Great. Bramante makes it better.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - close to Vatican and accessible to all sites”
Reviews.Author: tmcdee
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our stay at Hotel Bramante. We travelled with our 15 year old son so booked a triple room. Room was spacious and adequate for the limited time we were there. The hotel has a small garden that was nice for an afternoon refreshment or read. Breakfast was a feast and great way to fuel up for busy day. Walking distance to Vatican, Metro, Tiber River for pleasant evening strolls. Neighbourhood restaurants and pub down the street frequented by more locals than tourists. We were looking for a quiet place and this was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Rome..Yes it can be done”
Reviews.Author: Oumie
Reviews.Content: We arrived being greeted by the owner with a bright smile, english and advice where to park the car. The owners made us feel very welcome, comfortable, which was wonderful as I'd had a fall and need medical attention. Their friendly faces were most welcome hence a great start, and the staff were just as friendly and helpful. The bags just disappeared, it was like a weight was lifted. The room was large, appointed well and the air-conditioning was working and on a 38+ deg day it was welcome. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful. We had lunch just down the road which was wonderful, followed by dinner just near by. Everything is close to this hotel but you do not feel that you are in such a busy end of town as its quiet. Location: close to Vatican city - its at the end of the street. We chose the hotel for its location to a Hospital. We also had a car hence a local car park was essential, hence the one 5 mins to St Peters steps was perfect There is a discount for tourist of 15 euros a day - you need to claim this on the Bus terminal level ( level 2 -I think)

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: annarbor007
Reviews.Content: We are three nights into our four night stay at Hotel Bramante and it's perfect. We are here at the recommendation of European relatives who stayed here last year. My wife and I and two children are staying in a quad room. The location near the Vatican is great for us. We have walked or taken the convenient 110 bus line to many of the other top sites in town. The restaurants in the area are fun with very good food. The breakfast served at Hotel Bramante is substantial and excellent--espresso, cappacino, lattes, fresh fruit, egg dish, every cereal and juice imaginable, fresh cheeses and bread. One of my daughters needed to see a doctor and the proprietors, who are so friendly, arranged to get us to the international hospital here to see an English speaking doctor. They also obtained Vatican admission tickets for us. The hotel has a charming outside patio on the second floor and excellent WIFI connection. The staff, to a person, have been friendly and accomodating. We couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the Vatican/St Peter's”
Reviews.Author: dubsthcentralboy
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for meetings at the Vatican so it was an absolutely perfect location. I could be at the Santa Anna gate from the hotel in 3 minutes. It is situated just off the Borgo Pio (which runs parallel with the Via della Conciliazione). The hotel itself is clean and quite. The rooms are average by Roman standards but of a good size. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel at all but there are lots of bars nearby for a caffe or cornetto in the morning in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bramante was a great choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelOnOccasion_23
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the recommendation of family, who have returned to Hotel Bramante more than once. The location is just around the corner from the Vatican complex, which is great. Nearby streets have many choices for dining. The only complaint about location is that it is several blocks from the nearest Metro station. But the walk to the Metro is through nice areas and some of the less expensive shopping areas. The room (#12, straight up the stairs from the lobby) was very clean. The ONLY complaint is that our room window faced the narrow, one-way street out front. Cars and motorcycles were easily heard, but pretty much stopped after 10:00 pm. However, it was nice to be able to look out the window to see the activity on the street below. The staff and owners are very nice and helpful. Enough English is spoken to be helpful. The morning breakfast (included in the price of our room) was very good. The attending hostess was quick to make whatever style of coffee you prefer, and to bring out prosciutto, if desired. We would not hesitate to return

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure in the heart of Vatican Walls”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsforever
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the service at the "Bramante" was excellent. My husband and 2 young children (6and8) discovered the hotel by chance (through the "lonely planet" book, only after our original hotel reservations at another hotel (the name should forever be banned in our minds) cancelled our reservations without letting us know and after 24 hours of travel overseas from Canada, in August 2010. We were tired, had lack of sleep, jet lagged and trudged along the cobblestone roads from the other hotel to the Bramante with all of our luggage and two kids in tow. The reception we got at the "Bramanted" was very welcoming, but my husband and I were not the greatest guests at the beginning from our bad experience at the previous hotel and from our severe lack of sleep. We were the ones who were not very nice, but the owners of the hotel were amazingly patient and did not respond to our venting of our frustrations on them! The owners did not need our business or our frustrations, but the wife (whose family has owned the hotel since 1873), her husband, and their daughter were very patient, kind, and even tried to joke with us to put us at ease. Their reception of us was enough to put the guilt in my husband and I for our behavior. THey accepted our apology with graciousness and always greeted us every morning. Our room accomodated the four of usand they had a king size bed for my husband and I, a pullout twinbed sofa and another roll bed to accomodate the children. The room had beautiful rugs on them and the decor is traditional. The walls are thin, so if you have young children, you will need to advise them to really keep their inside voices. The street that the hotel is on is very quiet in the evening, but during the day, you can hear the street noise through your windows. The attached bathroom has marble floors and very modern amenities and the shower is great. The towels were always fresh and they even provided toothbrushes and toothpaste in the bathroom. The hotel has no elevators so you must climb the stairs, it has three floors. The reception area is very welcome with couches on the side. People with laptops can get wifi there it seemed. Attached to the main floor was their breakfast area. It had about 6 tables that seated 4 and there was always room as breakfast ran from 7am to 10am. The hotel also has a little patio garden off the first floor where there are two patio tables for you to sit. They have flowers, fresh basil, and other herbs growing there. The hallways are traditional and painted in robin's egg blue. Each room has its own air conditioner and safe. The breakfast that is included in the room rate is spectacular and is based on traditional Italian flair. They have an assortment of pastries, breads, abundant variety of cereals, cold cuts (prosciutto ham to die for), fresh baby mozzarella, fresh tomatoes, variety of juices, jams, cookies, egg omelets, fresh fruit salad and fruit. They have a wonderful lady that serves you fresh cups of cappucino or expresso if you want. We could of stayed all morning just eating. The hotel itself is situated in the old walls of Vatican and is superbly situated. It is five minutes walk from the Vatican (but you do not get the noise or crowdedness of the Vatican. It is about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the main metro, but we discovered on our last full day there that we were able to walk to many of the famous places from our hotel (Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps to name a few). It is also 5 minute walk to the Tiber river with a castle museum across the river. Therefore, I can not say enough about the location of the hotel (location is great but still remained quiet and away from the crowds). I was able to visit the Basilica in the later afternoon to avoid all the crowds because we were so close. Retrospectively, we could of walked to way more places instead of taking the metro. The hotel is just 5 minute walk away from a main street of restuarants and small little markets (where you can buy water and snacks for way cheaper rates). We went to a restaurant called "Romolo" that was recommended by the staff at the hotel and it was great food served by friendly waiters. Less than 10 minute walk from the hotel. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and kept the place very clean and a welcome air conditioned lobby after a hot day of exploring the eternal city. My husband and I would definitely recommend this hotel to people with children and without. THe service is impeccable, the breakfast is awesome, location is great! Although our trip to Rome started off frustratingly bad, we stumbled across a jewel of a hotel that surpassed our original hotel. A great family runned business (and I can see why it has lasted for over a century). On our check out date, the owner even gave us a container of their own extra virgin olive oil to take home. To the owners of Hotel Bramante, if you are reading this, thank you very much for your hospitality and understanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service was superb”
Reviews.Author: okbeth
Reviews.Content: We ended a three week Italy trip at Hotel Bramante. We found the owners and staff extremely helpful with our numerous requests. The rooms were elegant and quite. The terrace was lovely. My only complaint was that the shower only had a curtain and water leaked out. Small annoyance compared to the rest of the experience. Go outside the Vatican area for good dining.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel -Highly recommend it !”
Reviews.Author: Carlashel
Reviews.Content: This small family run hotel is minutes walk from the vatican in a quiet area.It is very clean and comfortable with a good generous breakfast with friendly helpful staff.The rooms were a good size with many extra's including toothbrushes and tooth paste! We were a mixed group from Grandmothers to teenagers and we all loved the hotel. We have been in many hotels around the world and found this one as good as any and totally suitable for a few wonderful days in Rome.(It was good as your Hiltons/Holidays Inns UK- probably better because it had character and personable staff) The hotel did not have a bar(the room mini bar was well stocked) but there are many restaurants just yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I felt Italian”
Reviews.Author: bzcandy
Reviews.Content: Hi all, Proprietors Loradonna (sp) and Maurizio are utterly priceless, dear, sincere and kind. The same goes for the ENTIRE staff who exist, it seems, to make you feel welcome. They endured my horrific mix of Spanish and Italian and by the time we made it to the room, I felt like an honorary Roman. Perfect location, spotless rooms, endless charm. Please support these great folks. Ccandy West and Elizabeth Frazier

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in Feb 2010. Had also stayed here back in 2007. Loved it both times! Excellent location by the Vatican. So wonderful to walk around St. Peter's in the moonlight and lots of small restaurants with reasonable prices for dinner. Rooms are charming and well furnished. Beds are hard as a rock, but we were so beat from sightseeing that it didn't matter. Bathrooms good sized and very clean. Breakfast buffet is fantastic - delicious and well stocked. The prosciutto and mozzarella! My mouth is watering at the thought! Internet was free, but didn't work too well in the rooms. Can't wait to go back. Enjoy Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel with Beautiful People”
Reviews.Author: rdavstar1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at Hotel Bramante, and definitely not the last! We were welcomed by the same faces from two years ago who, when we walked in, recognized us from our last stay with the warmest of greetings. They were so happy to see us, commenting how they remembered my boyfriend's long, black braid in the back. They were once again so very accomodating, giving us a room on the first floor; a sparkeling clean room with a very scrubbed and shiny bathroom. The air conditioning was fabulous, and very welcoming after a hot day spent walking the streets of Rome. I cannot express enough how wonderful this hotel is, and how friendly the staff. When we left, they gave us a complimentary gift of olive oil. Such a special touch from some very special people. We cannot wait for our return and see our friends at Hotel Bramante again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, value, and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeana_9
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Bramante in Rome was very relaxing and enjoyable. The staff was friendly, professional and always helpful. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the level of service we received. They arranged transportation to and from the airport and answered any questions we had. The hotel is very close to the Vatican in a safe area, close to restaurants. The breakfast provided was outstanding with a wide variety of choices and the staff serving breakfast very accommodating. I couldn’t have asked for a better place. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay guys away from it!”
Reviews.Author: Marco897
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bramante Hotel recently. I don't know when the carpet was last cleaned in the hall. The bathroom was large and seemed cleaner than the room. But the rooms in the photo appear large and they are not. They are small, too small and uncomfortable, AND NO ELEVATOR IN THE HOTEL! Although I’m a very regular traveler, I don’t usually make comments on places I’ve stayed, but I’ve rarely wanted to warn people to stay away from a place as much as I do the Hotel Bramante. For the price that we paid, Bramante did not meet our expectations at all. STAY GUYS AWAY FROM IT!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccctravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed this week at the Hotel Bramante with my Parents. The property is in a great location right next to the Vatican. Close by are tons of restaurants plus it is only a 10 minute walk to Piazza Navona/Pantheon, etc. We were also very close to the Castle Sant Angelo that had awesome views of Rome! The front desk is very nice and helpful .. and while their English isn't perfect, they make every effort to help you feel welcome and taken care of! The hotel has been recently renovated and you can tell. The rooms and bathrooms while not large in size are very well taken care of and have new tile/floors, etc. We really loved the small courtyard where you can sit outside and relax. Someone at this hotel has a green thumb and it shows .. there are tons of beautiful plants scattered around. The breakfast in the morning was great . .tons of options and very yummy! We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “least favorite hotel durig two week tour of Italy”
Reviews.Author: travelinghoosier
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as a result of the reviews on this website. The location is terrific if you want to be close to Vatican City, as it is only a few minutes walk. The room was okay, a little musty. The staff were not friendly, we rarely saw them smile. We had a miscommunication inwhich we thought we had transportation arranged and someone from the hotel would pick us up. After waiting awhile, we contacted the hotel to learn that it had not been arranged. We took a taxi instead, and it was cheaper anyhow. When we arrived at the hotel, the individual working wanted to see a copy of the confirmation. We did not have a printed copy, but I informed him it was on my Blackberry. The gentlemen then was insistent on reviewing my Blackberry emails. He was quite persistent to demonstrate that they had not made a mistake about the transportation pick up. We were not concerned, took it as a miscommunication, and planned to forget about it. The gentleman continued to be persistent wanting to review my Blackberry (which had a poor signal) to locate the multiple emails regarding the transportation arrangement. We felt he was more concerned with proving himself correct than checking us in. We were not even going to mention it once we arrived at the hotel, but he continued to bring it up. Unfortunately, that is the annoying memory we have of the hotel. Breakfast okay, lots of bugs flying around the food. The best part, again, was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: docrjj
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room little but very nice. The bathroom was really little, but adequate. But, the location is ideal. You are steps away from the Vatican, and short walks to Old Rome, and historic squares, piazzas, etc. The breakfast was simply wonderful, and there are lots of good eateries to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travelrg
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome and we stayed at a perfect Hotel. Very short walk to St. Peters Square. Quaint, well maintained family business just through the stone wall near the Vatican. Room was surprisingly big and clean. Timber ceilings and shiny tile floors. Ladies doing the breakfast were happy and made the experience very enjoyable. Great food; various fruits, meats, breads, cereals, cheeses, juices etc. and good coffee. Front desk staff, especially Antonio, were very helpful with transpo, tour inforamtion and restaurant suggestions. We ate at two good places close by that were recommended by the hotel. If we ever get to Rome again we would stay at Hotel Bramante.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific little hotel”
Reviews.Author: poesy
Reviews.Content: A nice, small hotel with a welcoming staff and friendly owners. the hotel has been in the family since 1873 I was told. The breakfast is very good. My room had a window that looked on a little courtyard. The room was not huge, but large enough, very clean, and a little dark. The only drawback to my room was that the walls were thin and I could hear conversations next door and above. Also there was no bracket for the hand-held shower in the bath and so it could not be fixed to the wall for a real shower. Every room is different though, and as I left I was told that my room was the only one with that peculiar arrangement for the shower. Of course there is no elevator in such an old, small (charming) building, so people who need elevators should beware. It's an easy walk to St. Peter's and the Vatican. Borgo Pio street is around the corner, with restaurants and shops, but very closed up at night. Public transportation is limited in the area, though there is a #40 bus that stops about 6 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Luna-White
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for a two night stay at the hotel Bramante and loved it. It´s a small hotel (only 16 rooms) located in an old building in a cobbled street. The front desk staff are super friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet is really good and the location can´t be better. Just behind St Peter´s and a short walk from the bus stop that will take you back to Termini (number 40). We had room number 26 on the second floor. The room was spacious and had a flat screen TV, a complete basket of amenities in the bathroom and slippers for each guest. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and a couple of bakeries. The tourist busses also stop nearby. A great find and a highly recommended property.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bergenfamily
Reviews.Content: My family and me stayed at the Bramante for 5 nights during the end of september and beginning of october 2007. We found the hotel on the Internet and with some help from other hotels which were all occupied when we contacted them. We are very happy that the other hotels did not have any available rooms as we have now discovered a fantastic hotel with a superb location i Rome. It was our first time in Rome, and travelling with children from 4 years and upwards can be a bit of a challenge. However, with the Hotel Bramante as our "home" and plenty of good advice from the frendliest staff you can possibly think of, our holliday turned out to be fantastic. The hotel itself is very charming. We had a quadrople family room with an extra bed for the youngest member of the family. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was relatively small as you would expect in any big city, but could not have been nicer. Every morning we all woke up looking forward to a fantastic breakfast (even if we had a bit too much to eat the night before). Fresh bread, good selection of cheeses, fresh fruits, ham, cereals, juices and even cakes, all topped up with fantastic coffee and hot chockolate for the children. On a scale from 1 to 10 with 10 as best, I would give the rating 11. I have already recommende the hotel to other members of my family, and when we are going to Rome again, Bramante will be my obvious preferred choice. Thank you very much to all the Bramante-staff for making the stay so nice. Helge Bergen, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: Christine57dogs
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel as it was listed in Lonely Planet as an excellent Hotel to stay. It was very close to the Vatican. Our room was right on the street, we were above, so it was a little noisy at times. The room itself was huge, it wasnt cheap though, it cost 210 Euros a nite which for us as Aussies was almost the cost of the Hilton here. The breakfast was fantastic, beautiful coffee and fresh fare. Would stay there again and thoroughly recommend it. All the staff were fantastic to us which was comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frass
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Bramante was outstanding. The rooms were spotless and the staff was charming and very friendly. It is conveniently located to the Vatican and a short walk the all of Rome's sites. We enjoyed the breakfasts, the great service and especially the hospitality. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Helpful Staff at Hotel Bramante”
Reviews.Author: N0_luggage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently went to Rome to celebrate our 15th anniversary. We stayed at the Hotel Bramante - it is a small hotel within a 5 minute walk of St. Peter's Square and the Basilica of St. Peter. The continental breakfast is wonderful offering fruit, various cheeses, juices, pastries, breads, ham, and many other items. Needless to say it was much more than the normal 'standard fare' you get as a 'complementary breakfast'. The Hotel Staff, in particular Antonio, was very helpful in trying to get our bags from the airport. He must have called a minimum of 3 to 4 times each day until, on the 5th day we (finally) got our bags. The hotel staff was very professional, friendly, and made you feel welcome. They also can provide you with good recommendations for restaurants and for other information. I honestly cannot say enough good things about the hotel staff. My wife and I made the mistake of checking our baggage - and Alitalia had the bags for 4 days before they decided to deliver them on the 5th day. Note: They had the bags, knew where they were, and did not deliver them until the 5th day of our stay - the bags were also pilfered with items stolen from them - so DO NOT CHECK YOUR BAGS - please learn from our mistake! I would say the ONLY negative we had while in Rome was trying to deal with both United and Alitailia in trying to get our luggage and the staff of the Hotel Bramante was very helpful in providing us advice, guidance, and support.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: peppergibson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two separate nights at the Hotel Bramante in early September. We found the staff to be helpful, friendly and English-speaking. The room was very nice, elegant, spacious, and with great sheets, bathroom amenities, and an outstanding breakfast included. It's not cheap: our room was 190 Euros per night. And the beds are very, very firm in the style that I find is common in Western Europe. Another thing to note is that there is no elevator and the stairs between the 2nd and 3rd floors are steep so if you have children, are elderly, or have heavy bags, just be aware. One thing that surprised me was that no one offered to help us with our bags, and I think that was because there seemed to be only one staff person working at any given time at the desk. This hotel is very refined and understated and quiet, and since you cannot stay anywhere in Rome for less than 150 Euros per night and call it a hotel, I would definitely recommend it. Great proximity to common tourist sites like Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and nice restaurants. We felt safe and comfortable walking around the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: glimandri
Reviews.Content: The "Bramante" is a terrific small Hotel 300 feet from the Vatican. I don't think there is a closer Hotel to the Vatican. It is tucked away on one of the side street and therefore although you are very close the area is free of wondering tourist to the Vatican. The frnt staf was exceptionally courteous and helpful. The room is comfortable, with modern facility,a very clean, marble bath. The breakfast is also excellent. I had to leave early in the morning, nevertheless the waitress there offred to cook me full breakfast. The only negative thing about this gem is that there is no elevator in the "Bramante". You have to realize that is a very historic building, probably 200 years old or so, however. I would go back to the "Bramante"in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bramante was great”
Reviews.Author: mattwolf_uk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girfriend stayed at the Hotel Bramante for 3 nights towards the end of August, we had booked a 4 day trip to Rome without accomodation, intending on touring around and spending each night in a different hotel. However once we found the Bramante in our guide book and checked in for the first night, we just didn't want to leave. We were greeted by the friendliest of staff, the guy behind the reception desk, who asked us at the end of our stay, if we did decide to review the hotel, to refer to him as 'the bald receptionist' (he did ask, I'm not just being rude!) we were then given the key to a beautiful room, (there are only about 25 rooms, so i'm assuming each are as loveley, clean and welcoming as ours was.) One of the great things about this Hotel is it's stunning location, just tucked away down a quaint little side street, but walk less than 100 yards to the end of the street and there is st Peters Basilica in front of you, stunning! The morning after our first nights stay we had a great breakfast, (in with the very reasonable price of the room) and the lady serving was lovely. We then dicided to book in for the next 2 nights, with the bald recepionist! We had a great stay at the Hotel Bramante and we would both highly reccomend it to anyone planning a trip to Rome. Cheers everyone, Matthew and Joanne

Reviews.Title: “Perfectamundo!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter095
Reviews.Content: friendly staff (he must have said "may god bless you" a hundred times!) I thought the maids did an amazing job, serving breakfast, making excellent coffee and turning our room down perfectly everyday. Simple, unpretentious, warm - Faultless

Reviews.Title: “Quite, helpful and close”
Reviews.Author: D_PN
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Bramante. Its location in the Borgo on a small alleyway made it a peaceful place to stay, even though the Vatican, with it crowds, was only a few blocks away. The desk staff, especially Massimo, were extremely helpful with directions and making dinner reservations. The room and bath were clean and freshly decorated although not extravagant. Breakfast was excellent with choices including fruit, yogurt, ricotta, cereal, bread, pastry, eggs, and coldcuts. There were some adequate restaurants in the residential parts of the Borgo, but it was only a 5-10 min. walk to Piazza Navona or Campo dei Fiore for a good choice of restaurants. Sightseeing from here was simple. You could easily reach most of tourist Rome on foot and public buses reaching into all parts of the city had stops near the hotel. Not the place to stay if you want to party all night, but a great spot if you like your hotel to be a quite respite from a busy city. We'll definately stay here on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Turning 60 wasn't so bad!”
Reviews.Author: TessOverlandPark
Reviews.Content: My oldest son, who has travelled extensively in Europe (but never in Italy), generously planned a trip for us in celebration of my 60th birthday. We were both very impressed with the staff (who knew English), accomodations (yes, we had to walk up a flight of stairs but then Rome IS a city where you are expected to walk!!), delicious breakfast (the Italian "Mama" was so hard working and always made sure we had what we needed). The room was very clean, bathroom was what I considered to be European style with thick towels and a great shower, and the "slippers" fit and will be a nice remembrance for me. It was old world charm as I looked out our window and could see a young girl in an apartment across the way looking back at me. We loved it and would stay at the Hotel Bramante again!! Ciao!! Penny Clodfelter Overland Park, KS

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Rome :-)”
Reviews.Author: FIUgirl07
Reviews.Content: After a 14 hour flight, I was delighted to finally arrive at Hotel Bramante. The shuttle driver from the hotel was very friendly and welcoming to our tired and weary group. The exquisite decor, genuinely friendly staff, affordable rate and close proximity to the Vatican and to local transit was a winning combination! The area around the hotel is very peaceful (for a good night's rest!) and the breakfast (colazione) was the best that I had in all of Italy (and I visited 5 other cities!). Italian hotels are notorious for having thin walls (compared to the U.S.) but I was able to sleep peacefully since the walls are very well insulated. I enjoyed the very comfortable surroundings and beautiful patio! Without a doubt, I will pick Hotel Bramante as my hotel of choice! Thanks! :-)

Reviews.Title: “it's nice but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: UUSIMAA
Reviews.Content: i choosed this hotel because of good location ,not far from Vatican City. Hotel is nice inside, but without elevetor. what i didnt like that from outside is a bit ugly and,to my mind, there are some problems with stuff. for example, some of porters don't speak english, sorry, it's hotel and these workers should know english for giving information end helping to their clients!!!!!!!! i could suggest to take some english language courses. breakfast is good and again why waitresses look so much at clients and speak about them !!!! seams that they never saw foreigners,it is not professional from one point of you!!!! i didnt feel very comfortable ,really. BUT cappucino and coffeo is good there!! so, generaly speaking i liked hotel but i didnt like serviss there at all,i mean, there aren't english speakers but there are strange waitresses:))). hopefully next time ,if i will come , i will find good speaking porters and kind waitresses !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Giovedi
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 6 friends and we rent a triple and a quad room. We all loved this hotel. Great location, great breakfast, charming decor. The staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here any time I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: maleni50
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Hotel Bramante in Rome and had a marvelous time! Four of us stayed in a quad room with ample space and great atmosphere. The staff was friendly, helpful and very professional. The breakfast was wonderful and we were greeted each morning with great food and smiling faces. Walking through the streets of Rome to see the sights was an experience of a lifetime. I highly recommend this hotel, its proximity to the Vatican was great as we were there almost every day. Thank you Hotel Bramante!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but charming area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room early November 04. Paid 198 euro per night. No elevator. Room nice, but nothing memorable. This is a B+B. Shower only - No bathtub. Location good. Borgo Pio just around the corner, convenient for choice of al fresco dining. Stay here if street noise does not bother you and you want to be close to the Vatican, Castel S. Angelo, etc. Definitely preferable to staying anywhere near the Railway station - LOADS more atmosphere and charm in this area. However you can get 4-5 star accommodation at this price in same area if you hunt on the net. Desk staff were great. However witnessed unfortunate incident at breakfast room which is tiny. Waitress turned away businessman as no table free, although plenty of spare seats at tables for 4 where only 1 client sat. He said he had to rush off to work and could he not have a coffee and a roll in the foyer lounge? No, Waitress insisted he come back later. A young American who spoke Italian overhead and invited the businessman to join his table.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bramante last week for 5 nights and were very impressed with the professionalism and kindness of the staff. Antonio who usually mans the front desk is incredibly helpful and speaks great English. The breakfast staff don't speak much English but were unfailingly cheerful and uncomplainingly served us a full breakfast at 7 am one morning - although the official breakfast time does not begin until 7:30 am. The breakfast is incredibly varied and will please even the pickiest eater. The hotel itself is in a quiet area of town and is a charming antiques-filled townhouse with wooden beams, Oriental rugs and fresh flowers. The rooms, while small, are nicely decorated and have plenty of cold AC if you need it. The only potential drawback is the location - next to the Vatican. There is not a lot of "action" in the hotel's immediate vicinity but it is only a nice 15 minute walk to the Piazza Navona where there is plenty going on. TWe felt the location was a plus actually - it was so peaceful and quiet - ie. no buzzing scooters or loud busses. We will definitely stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Bramante
HotelInfo.Address: Vicolo delle Palline, 24, 00193 Rome, Italy
